questions.latexText: \(Let A(4cost, 4sint), B(2sint, –2cost) and C(3r – n, r^{2} – n – 1) be the vertices of a triangle ABC, where t is a parameter. If (3x – 1) 2 + (3y) 2 = , is the locus of the centroid of triangle ABC, then  equals : (1) 20 (2) 8 (3) 6 (4) 18\)

questions.text: Three defective oranges are accidently mixed with seven good ones and on looking at them, it is not possible to differentiate between them. Two oranges are drawn at random from the lot. If x denote the number of defective oranges, then the variance of x is : (1) 28/75 (2) 14/25 (3) 26/75 (4) 18/25
questions.formattedText: Three defective oranges are accidently mixed with seven good ones and on looking at them, it is not possible to differentiate between them. Two oranges are drawn at random from the lot. If x denote the number of defective oranges, then the variance of x is : (1) 28/75 (2) 14/25 (3) 26/75 (4) 18/25
questions.latexText: \(Three defective oranges are accidently mixed with seven good ones and on looking at them, it is not possible to differentiate between them. Two oranges are drawn at random from the lot. If x denote the number of defective oranges, then the variance of x is : (1) \frac{28}{75} (2) \frac{14}{25} (3) \frac{26}{75} (4) \frac{18}{25}\)
